thread.title: Falcons Are Getting Roasted for Blowing a 28-3 Lead in the Super Bowl
thread.title_full: Falcons Are Getting Roasted for Blowing a 28-3 Lead in the Super Bowl | Complex

author: Jose Martinez
title: Falcons Are Getting Roasted for Blowing a 28-3 Lead in the Super Bowl
text:
Falcons Are Getting Roasted for Blowing a 28-3 Lead in the Super Bowl By Jose Martinez Jose is a contributing writer for Complex Media. @ZayMarty 
Feb 06, 2017 Share Tweet 0 Image via USA Today Sports/Eric Seals When the Atlanta Falcons took a 28-3 lead over the New England Patriots in the third quarter, it looked like they had their Super Bowl LI victory all locked up. Hell, even supposed Patriots fan Mark Wahlberg  thought it was done. 
Never forget, New England. @Mark_Wahlberg left the #SB51 & we won the game. (via @Allen_Reid ) pic.twitter.com/eXInXHWbTI 
‚Äî Only In Boston (@OnlyInBOS) February 6, 2017 Then, Tom Brady helped orchestrate the biggest comeback in Super Bowl history, leading the Patriots to a 34-28 win in overtime. After the Falcons officially blew a 28-3 lead in the Super Bowl, the internet went to work. 
Falcons blew a 28-3 lead pic.twitter.com/f8E9CvLMHY 
‚Äî Clayron (@gotpickle) February 6, 2017 Falcons blew a 28-3 lead... 28+3=31... I think we know where this leads pic.twitter.com/z3rxxAViZe 
‚Äî Mason (@therealMaseyJ) February 6, 2017 DONT EVER LET ANYTHING DISTRACT YOU FROM THE FACT THAT THE FALCONS BLEW A 28-3 LEAD
‚Äî Dan üåê (@MookieThaGod) February 6, 2017 As a Golden State Warriors fan, I feel for Atlanta Falcons fans right now.

Up 3-1 vs. Up 28-3. pic.twitter.com/Qjhz95WjF8 
‚Äî Billy Anders (@mrbillyanders) February 6, 2017 @LazarBeamYT Falcons blew a 28-3 lead * pic.twitter.com/Bxum0fdu6Y 
‚Äî Neha's Bitch (@lecheisbad) February 6, 2017 Now, we can't help but wonder which team caught the bigger L? 
So who took the biggest L Golden State blowing a 3-1 Lead or The Falcons blowing 28-3 lead?? pic.twitter.com/1vfK5Quxq2 
‚Äî Alejandro Albors (@the_real_ale4) February 6, 2017 Either way, you know the Warriors are more than happy to pass on the baton to the Falcons. 
Warriors fans after the falcons choked a 28-3 lead pic.twitter.com/EBumvkRRXb 
‚Äî jv fan acc (@RapsBetter) February 6, 2017 The #Falcons blew a 28-3 lead. pic.twitter.com/YoLaERWPIs 
‚Äî BigHeadSports (@BigHeadSports) February 6, 2017 Send all complaints, compliments, and tips to  sportstips@complex.com . 
Related The 50 Biggest Fails in Super Bowl History Play Breakers: Immortal Super Bowl Moments Falcons' Robert Alford Picks Off Tom Brady, Returns It for a Touchdown Tags: News , Atlanta Falcons , Football , NFL
